body_html:
@gunan thanks! The reason seems to be that map returns an iterator rather than a list in Python3. Will fix now.
By the way, how do I reproduce this kind of failures locally? I was running tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh CPU tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh and tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh CPU bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/opt:multitask_optimizer_wrapper_test which did not report any errors. Probably there is a separate tool to check py2to3 compatibility in the CI suite that I am not aware of?

body:
@gunan thanks! The reason seems to be that `map` returns an iterator rather than a list in Python3. Will fix now.
By the way, how do I reproduce this kind of failures locally? I was running `tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh CPU tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_sanity.sh` and `tensorflow/tools/ci_build/ci_build.sh CPU bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/opt:multitask_optimizer_wrapper_test` which did not report any errors. Probably there is a separate tool to check py2to3 compatibility in the CI suite that I am not aware of?
